content: was taking a look at https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/diagnostics.html
and ended wondering if that section should be in Part 1
actually I'm starting to think that we may be able to organize better what's in Part 1
maybe Part 1 should just be a section for building, running tests and all that
Diagnostics could be moved elsewhere, but unsure where
I think Debugging could be a full section and I'd love if we can have more content
contributing could be an appendix
and there are things there that could go into forge like Stability attributes
maybe if we think we could discuss this we can add the idea to our backlog and discuss in our next sprint planning
@WG-rustc-dev-guide :point_up:
@Santiago Pastorino I agree that Part 1 could definitely be organized better.
And that we should discuss more at the meeting
I disagree that we should move anything to the forge (but then again, I'm biased since I moved a lot of that content here to begin with)
And I also think that contributing should not be an appendix... I almost feel that that is the most important part of the book
Also, I could imagine diagnostics going at the end of the overview section after the arenas part
Linting could also fit well into the 'Analysis' chapter
although that's more about type analysis than code analysis :|
@mark-i-m yeah I'd say that we should start grabbing ideas in our task document so we can discuss and decide what's next
some of my ideas are: guide organization and taking rustc debugging tricks to extreme (this also includes explaining every single data structure around, see this for example)

Santiago Pastorino said:

some of my ideas are: guide organization and taking rustc debugging tricks to extreme (this also includes explaining every single data structure around, see this for example)

re: debugging tricks -> +1
in my opinion is one of the most important things if we want to lower the barrier to contribute, if it's not the most important one :)

Personally, I lean towards trying to finish some of the other things that are open... there are still something like 90 open issues on the repo. And there are a bunch of other initiatives that we started but never quite followed though on, like the compiler lecture series
let's discuss during the planning I'd say :)
we should define a date for it, right?
don't remember when exactly was our sprint finishing but I guess we've said once overview is done
Oh, I was thinking we could just use the meeting on Tuesday?
Perhaps we can just extend it to 1 hour?
@WG-rustc-dev-guide ^^^ what do you think?
No problem for me
let's do that
have updated the calendar event
